program: Master of Science in Computational Science and Engineering (CSE SM)

sections.text: The CSE SM is an interdisciplinary, research‑oriented master’s that trains students in computational methods for the study, design, and operation of complex engineered and natural systems.
Students complete a core across computational foundations, choose electives aligned to applications, and complete a master’s thesis.

items: Maintain good academic standing (per CCSE policies)
Graduate Writing Exam; technical writing if required
sections.text: Degree requirements include approved coursework distribution and a research thesis; students must meet CCSE academic standards.
Graduates pursue computational roles in engineering, applied sciences, and data‑intensive industries.
